properties.areaDesc: Southern Brevard County; Martin; Northern Brevard County; St. Lucie; Indian River; Coastal Volusia
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 30 at 4:05AM EST until January 30 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Rough, choppy surf, and a strong southward flowing
longshore current, and rip currents near piers and jetties are
expected.

* WHERE...Southern Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie, Martin,
Coastal Volusia and Northern Brevard Counties.

* WHEN...Through 7 pm this evening.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surf conditions. Rip currents
may sweep even strong swimmers away from shore and into deeper
water. While rip currents will be present all day, the threat
will be highest surrounding the low tide cycle through 830 AM
this morning and again from 230 PM into early evening.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...To reduce your risk of becoming caught in
the seaward pull of a rip current, swim only within sight of a
lifeguard, and never swim alone.
properties.instruction:
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING
